description: This file defines a Log class for structured logging and message output within a Python software project, including methods for info, warning, error, and documentation issue messages, with support for terminal color coding and context-aware line reporting.

classes.name: Log
classes.description: A class providing structured logging functionality with support for different message levels, color-coded output, and context-aware reporting.

methods.name: __init__(self, name, verbose = False, warnings = True, doc_issues = False)
methods.description: Constructor initializing the Log object with a name, verbosity, warning and doc issue flags, setting up color codes based on OS.

methods.name: __Print(self, text, file="")
methods.description: Internal method to output a message to the console, optionally with a prefix.

methods.name: Info(self, text, file="")
methods.description: Logs an informational message with optional file context.

methods.name: InfoLine(self, obj, text, file="")
methods.description: Logs a line-specific informational message, extracting file and line number from the provided object.

methods.name: DocIssue(self, text, file="")
methods.description: Logs a documentation-related issue message if such issues are enabled.

methods.name: Warn(self, text, file="")
methods.description: Logs a warning message with optional file context.

methods.name: WarnLine(self, obj, text, file="")
methods.description: Logs a warning message with context on file and line, extracting details from provided object.

methods.name: Error(self, text, file="")
methods.description: Logs an error message with optional file context.

methods.name: Print(self, text, file="")
methods.description: Outputs a plain message to the console, with optional file context.

methods.name: Dump(self)
methods.description: Outputs all accumulated log messages (errors, warnings, infos).

methods.name: Header(self, text)
methods.description: Prepares logging for a new file, setting file name and printing a processing message.

methods.name: Ellipsis(self,text, front=True)
methods.description: Truncates a string to 32 characters, adding ellipsis at front or back.

ctags.name: __init__
ctags.pattern: /^    def __init__(self, name, verbose = False, warnings = True, doc_issues = False):$/
ctags.signature: (self, name, verbose = False, warnings = True, doc_issues = False)
